title: My Bigpond emails in outlook 2007 emails wont populate into TB
content:
i am moving my accounts from outlook 2007 to Tb slowly doing one account at a time, making sure it all works, then moving on the the next account, i have already moved my hotmail.com & outlook.com emails accounts to TB successfully and all the inbox, sent and draft emails also went to TB with ease.

I now have 2 bigpond accounts i want to move to TB from outlook 2007, i am only going to move one at a time and once one is fully working , ill move the other one. So now i am trying to move one of my bigpond.com email accounts to TB, the account moved over ok, but its not bringing over any of my inbox, sent, draft, or other folders with it at all.

the bigpond account in TB works for new messages in and out, but none of my emails previous and older emails from outlook came with it. i have removed the account twice and still same issue. there was a warning or something that popped up during the first time i tried this with bringing the bigpond over to TB, cant remember what it said, but something along the lines of bigpond isnt trusted or veryifed certificate. i cant really recall. but maybe that is why. i copied the same settings from outlook 2007 to TB, i even tried setting them to pop for one try and them imap the next try, i still dont know.

is there a way to find the log warning message any where on TB as to what happen during the first try of adding the bipond account, maybe that will help you guys narrow down the issue. As that warning does not come up any more when i remove and try to add the account again, it just happened the first time. i though if hotmail can work easily ( being so old ) then bigpond should definitely have no issues. maybe its a pop or Imap issue, i dont know ???
creator: dj.moonwalker

content:

I do not want to ever have to sign onto Google and this is all new. I want to get Google off my Thunderbird. I can access my email only from Google. No thank you. I hope someone has some idea on what I should do. Thank you, Philip

I also redownloaded Thunderbird to no avail.

title: Sensitivity headers not available on Thunderbird and Add-in not compatible with current version
content:
Hello everyone, Do you know of any way how to use the sensitivity headers (normal, personal, private, confidential) on Thunderbird? The Sensitivity Header is not compatible with the current version of Thunderbird and Thunderbird itself does not seem to have this simple function.

Is there any Thunderbird developer here? I suppose this is not a compliacated implementation (you already have options for receipt and delivery status headers, I suppose adding the sensitivity tag wouldn't be anything hard). Would you please consider this for your next release?

Thanks a lot!

title: Request for Feature to Automatically Track Sent Emails Without Replies
content:
Dear Thunderbird Support Team,

I hope this message finds you well.

I am writing to inquire about a feature in Thunderbird that I have not been able to set up successfully. I need a way to automatically track sent emails that have not yet received a reply. My goal is to have a folder that dynamically contains all my sent messages that haven't received any response. Once a reply is received, the message should automatically disappear from this folder.

Here is a more detailed description of what I am trying to achieve:

Sent emails are automatically copied to a specific folder. This folder should only contain sent messages that have not yet been replied to. Once a reply to a sent message is received, the original sent message should automatically be removed from the folder. I have tried using the saved searches feature, but it does not fully meet my needs as it does not dynamically update based on replies received.

Is there a way to accomplish this with the current version of Thunderbird, or is there a plugin or extension that you can recommend to achieve this functionality? If this feature is not currently available, I would like to request its consideration for future updates.

Thank you for your time and assistance. I look forward to your guidance on how to set up this functionality or any recommendations you may have.

Best regards, Chris
creator: k.wojtkowiak

title: Sorting emails by date doesn't work
content:

I would expect that clicking on the date header (which tooltip "Sort by date") would do that, but it's not the case).

For example: https://imgur.com/hhCd9zF.png (also attached).

In the screenshot, from top to bottom, you can see emails sent in July 2023, then August 2023, then July 2023 again, then more August 2023. The order is clearly messed up.

I've had this issue for a very long time and it's very hampering.

Thanks. Cheers, Manuel

title: Data errata dei messaggi ricevuti
content:
Buongiorno, il giorno 5/07 scorso ho installato Thunderbird sul mio computer con Windows10 e ho configutato i miei account di posta elettronica TISCALI, GMAIL e HOTMAIL seguendo la configurazione automatica.

Sul mio account (imap) TISCALI " 'ho riscontrato il seguente problema: Molti messaggi della posta in arrivo (circa 40 su circa 3500) sono stati importati da 'Thunderbird con una data errata, più esttamente: a molti messaggi della posta in arrivo è stata assegnata da Thunderbird una data di ricezione uguale a quella della installazione di Thunderbird (5/07/2024) pur essendo essi antecedenti a tale data anche di diversi anni, ad esempio un messaggio ricevuto il 12/01/2023, su Thunderbird appare come ricevuto il 5/07/2024. Potete aiutarmi a risolvere questo problema? N.B. il problema esposto si presenta solo sulla posta in arrivo di TISCALI e non sugli altri miei account di posta.

Grazie

title: electronic signing of email / elektronicke podepsani emailu
content:
Ahoj, Thunderbird mi u vsech zprav ktere jsou elektronicke podepsane hlasi ze podpis neni platny ale to je chyba. V ostatnich klientech(Outlook, EMclient)se podpis u zpravy zobrazi jako platny. Stejne tak kdyz chci odesilat s elektronickym podpisem. Nejde to. Mam nastaveny platny kvalifikovany certifikat pro spravny mail ale nemohu odesilat ani elektronicky podepsane ani sifrovane. Zkousel jsem to i na jinem PC, v jinem uctu windows ale problem je porad vsude stejny. Ostatni klienti nemaji problem ani pri odesilani.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Hi, Thunderbird tells me that the signature is not valid for all messages that are electronically signed, but this is an error. In other clients (Outlook, EMclient) the signature is displayed as valid. The same when I want to send with an electronic signature. It doesn't work. I have set up a valid qualified certificate for the correct mail, but I cannot send either electronically signed or encrypted. I have tried it on another PC, in another windows account but the problem is still the same everywhere. Other clients have no problem even when sending.

Translated with DeepL.com (free version)

title: Large MBOX mail file to store and see through the Thunderbird program
content:
Hello,

We have MBOX mails sized by 46,321,930 KB and exported from Gmail account to store and save to see anytime. I understood this MBOX file only can be opened and see the contents through Thunderbird. We have a few questions to use this program properly. See the questions below and answer, please. 1. This file has been imported and visible with the same file name and the quantity of the 30,044 emails sign. However, the contents are not shown up after we click the file through Thunderbird. The contents were actually popped up a few days ago and currently are not visible at all. Please explain this happening and let us know how to manage these contents to check. 2. Even though we make these MBOX files imported in the Thunderbird program, we couldn't make sure that it is possibly open to see since it has disappeared in the program as said in a 1st question. We currently have this MBOX mail in the computer and would like to keep it in an external hard drive to open this file to see in the future. We wonder if it is possible to import anytime and on any device if they download the Thunderbird program and have the same MBOX file.   3. We are not familiar with the MBOX format, and Google didn't let us export the whole quantity of the 64GB emails (there are missing emails in specific beginning periods which are not able to be seen as the same as the emails at the Gmail account). We would like to know if we could trust this MBOX and Thunderbird program with no more missing emails. 

We might need to make a call to discuss more about the program and the file after checking your response.

Thank you. Best regards, Stella
